metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6251 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in GnuTLS before 3.3.17 and 3.4.x before 3.4.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a long DistinguishedName (DN) entry in a certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
libgnutls30 - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.3.15-5ubuntu2').
